decision_conditions: <p><span id="docs-internal-guid-5faa74ba-7fff-1867-7d83-f3cda01c25d7"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The proposed development, by reason of its size, design, and siting, would result in an obtrusive and incompatible form of development which would fail to respect the character and appearance of the subject property and the terrace of which it forms part, and would fail to preserve the character and appearance of the Brownswood Conservation Area. As such, </span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">contrary to policies LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character), LP3 (</span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">Designated Heritage Assets), </span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">LP17 (Housing Design) </span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">of LP33 Hackney Local Plan 2020, and Policies D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach), D4 (Delivering good design), HC1 (Heritage conservation and growth ) of the London Plan 2021 and Hackney's 'Residential Extensions and Alterations' SPD 2009. NPPF Paragraph 202</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-cd1fdc1f-7fff-92e3-503d-e4bc69d7202f"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposal, by reason of the failure to </span></span><span id="docs-internal-guid-cd1fdc1f-7fff-92e3-503d-e4bc69d7202f"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">provide adequate natural light and outlook to the basement unit, results in a </span></span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 11pt; white-space-collapse: preserve;">sub-standard form of accommodation which would be harmful to the living conditions of prospective occupiers. As such, the proposal would be contrary to policies </span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; white-space-collapse: preserve;">D3 (Optimising site capacity through the design-led approach) and D6 (Housing quality and standards) of the London Plan (2021) and policies </span><span style="background-color: transparent; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; white-space-collapse: preserve;">LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) and LP17 (Housing Design) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020). </span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-d0b6e5c3-7fff-ea35-64f1-484a16167020"></span></p><p dir="ltr" style="line-height:1.2;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt;"><span style="font-size:11pt;font-family:Arial,sans-serif;color:#000000;background-color:transparent;font-weight:400;font-style:normal;font-variant:normal;text-decoration:none;vertical-align:baseline;white-space:pre;white-space:pre-wrap;">The proposal, by reason of its failure to contribute to affordable housing, represents an unsustainable form of development for the borough. As such the proposal is contrary to policies LP1 (Design Quality and Local Character) and LP13 (Affordable Housing) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020) and the Supplementary Planning Document: S106 Planning Contributions (2020).</span></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-bfe0584f-7fff-5ab1-acf2-cdd3dabd9e18"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposal, by reason of its failure to provide a carbon off-set contribution to reduce carbon emissions,&nbsp; is contrary to policies LP54 and LP55 of the Hackney Local Plan (2020) and policies&nbsp;S1 2 (Minimising greenhouse gas emissions), and S1 3 (Energy Infrastructure) of the London Plan (2021) and Section 106 Planning contributions SPD (2020). </span></span><br></p>

<p><span id="docs-internal-guid-13722032-7fff-63af-54dc-5d502e156660"><span style="font-size: 11pt; font-family: Arial, sans-serif; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; font-variant-alternates: normal; font-variant-position: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space-collapse: preserve;">The proposal, by reason of its failure to provide a car-free development, reduce car usage, and promote active travel, is contrary to policy LP45 (Parking and Car-free Development) of the Hackney Local Plan (2020).</span></span><br></p>
description: Excavation of front garden to create front light well with staircase to lower ground floor and create basement studio flat, with new window and door
